Notes

Pretty decent source keeping in mind that this is a 0-day pre-release.

The source is heavily blocky during fast paced scenes, deblocking was not that easy here.
Even after heavy deblocking, there were hints of block edges in frames, so we did a two stage deblocking and minimized it to a pretty good extent.
Next, too much of ghosting (on progressive source), nothing could be done of that.
Source details got muted a bit during the process of deblocking, later they were brought out along with decent amount of sharpening.
Sharpening is not that heavy here as it would make the block edges visible again. Personally, I would any day prefer less sharpened video than heavily sharpened blocky one.
Coming to luma, it fluctuated every now and then, especially during bright (heavy light) scenes; we adjusted it to make it a bit more watchable.
Lastly, there was a heavy yellow tint throughout the movie with underlaying green tinge, they were toned down.

Audio is crisp & clear.

Check comparison below for the work done; confirm the same with multiple samples.

Remember? The name is? DDR!

Enjoy this until retails or Web-HDs roll out!
